meanings.definition: Make or become rough or harsh in texture or tone.
meanings.sent1: The sandpaper coarsened the surface of the wood.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the constant exposure to the elements coarsened the once smooth stone.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally coarsened the sauce by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent4: The years of hardship had coarsened her voice, giving it a rough edge.
meanings.sent5: The painter used a special technique to coarsen the texture of the canvas, creating a unique effect.

meanings.definition: Make or become less refined or cultured.
meanings.sent1: The reality show coarsened the behavior of the contestants.
meanings.sent2: Living in the city coarsened his manners compared to his upbringing in the countryside.
meanings.sent3: The comedy movie humorously portrayed how easily one can be coarsened by reality TV.
meanings.sent4: The fast-paced lifestyle of the city coarsened her sensibilities over time.
meanings.sent5: The influence of certain friends coarsened his taste in music, leading him to appreciate louder and more aggressive genres.
